server
Class GeoServer

java.lang.Object
  server.GeoServer

public class GeoServer
extends java.lang.Object

GeoServer is the Java class which lists the terminals connected. These terminals are the clients and send request to the server. They are saved in a HashMap, and the server propose then some REST services to the clients.

Version:
1.0 30/01/2014
Author:
Luc Clement, Arnaud Saunier

Constructor Detail

GeoServer

public GeoServer()
Method Detail

addGeoScalePath

public java.lang.String addGeoScalePath(java.lang.String name,
                                        java.lang.String lat,
                                        java.lang.String lon)
The addGeoScalePath method adds in the HashMap the different terminals which are connected to the server.

Parameters:
name - The name (i.e. the id) of the terminal connected.
lat - The lattitude of the position of the terminal.
lon - The longitude of the position of the terminal.
Returns:
"Success" after completing the task.
See Also:
GeoScalePath

smallestCommonPath

public SCPResponse smallestCommonPath(SCPQuery idGeoScalePaths)
                               throws javax.xml.bind.JAXBException
The smallestCommonPath method returns the smallest common path between the GeoScalePaths given in the list in arguments which are in the server Hashmap. It also returns the unknown id given in arguments

Parameters:
idGeoScalePaths - The list of the id of the GeoScalePaths concerned by the smallest common path we asked for, using the class SCPQuery (for auto marshalling with JaxB).
Returns:
The smallest common path between the known id, and a list containing the unknown id, using the class SCPResponse (for auto marshalling with JaxB).
Throws:
javax.xml.bind.JAXBException
See Also:
GeoScalePath, SCPQuery, SCPResponse

geoScalePathsInArea

public GeoScalePathList geoScalePathsInArea(GeoScalePathsInAreaQuery query)
                                     throws javax.xml.bind.JAXBException
The geoScalePathsInArea method consumes a GeoScalePathsInAreaQuery, that contains an ID of a geoScalePath (the reference) and a scale (the area is the instance of the scale associated to the given geoScalePath) and returns the list of all the geoScalePaths in this area.

Parameters:
query - The ID of the reference (geoScalePath) and the scale we use to determine the area
Returns:
a list of geoScalePaths
Throws:
javax.xml.bind.JAXBException

getGeoScalePath

public GeoScalePath getGeoScalePath(java.lang.String name)
The getGeoScalePath method returns the geoScalePath of which we gave the ID in argument. If the ID is unknown, it returns a empty geoScalePath

Parameters:
name - The ID of the geoScalePath.
Returns:
The geoScalePath
